name: places/ChIJARIXnYlZwokR6DGCYFHxhiA
formattedAddress: 200 E 10th St #718, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 E 10th St #718, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: AVOID DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH. I would give them a 0 star if I could. They don't complete tasks and often just claim they are out of time after only spending 5mins and need more to complete the task. I have been with them a year and can tell you they are a total scam. You will struggle to actually find something they can successfully do and get your money's worth. I think support is one guy named "Eduardo" who doesn't actually read messages and is completely unhelpful.

originalText.text: I am very disappointed with Fancyhands. I have quite a bit of spare time and have excellent communication and computer skills. I thought that I was perfect for the virtual assistant position so I applied. I am not sure if something is wrong with my speakers or if they are just turning everyone down but my application was denied with no explanation. I have no way to ask anyone there as to why either which is ridiculous. I am college educated and have owned my own company for many years. I certainly passed the ridiculously simple test they gave me so I would like to know why I was denied at least.

originalText.text: I have been a customer of fancy hands for two years. I strongly recommend that you do not become one. What's kept me with them for so long is that there are occasional flashes of Brilliance that keep you going. For example once they reduced my cable bill by $30 per month. However the vast majority of the time the other assistants are simply incompetent. What is worse still is at least twice assistants have contacted me privately outside of the system, begging me not to tell fancy hands or they would be fired. They then proceeded to complain about how they are paid and how bad and strict the management are to them. No matter how strict they are it does not help correct flaws in their business model. "If you pay peanuts you get monkeys" so someone said. Some of those will be more intelligent and provide those flashes of brilliance. The final straw after some 60 complaints over two years came when an assistant booked somebody to visit my home but that person didn't show up. When I questioned the person they provided evidence that the assistant had given them two different addresses for me, the last of which was incorrect, and they had not returned phone calls. As a result the person visiting me told me that they thought my assistant was actually someone playing games with them. If the image that fancy hands gives to people is that it is in fact a hoax or prank, what does that say about their level of service. When you pay your monthly fee you get an email from their CEO encouraging you to talk to him about any issues. However he actually stopped responding to me even though I was providing constructive ideas for solving the problems. I believe he knows how bad it is and has simply run out of words and therefore chooses to ignore those who continue to point out the same issues. But those issues are very serious and the concerns are one-hundred-percent valid. I wouldn't say fancy hands is a hoax or a prank but it is a bit of a joke. I am very sad to write this review but it is honest.

originalText.text:
Terrible service. Asked them to make a few phone calls for me and was double charged credits. Have another simply job and no one working on it for days. Asked support to help and was told they could not call me to assist only email and that Fancy Hands is behind on completing tasks at this time and I quote...

“We try our best to keep responses to within a few hours and 24 hours at max, but sometimes that's not possible. At this time, we are surely having delays and are making adjustments to address that, but it might take us a few weeks to catch up, as from 30-50 tasks at one time, we went to hundreds in a very short time.”

The reason you hire an assistant is because you are busy. If you have follow up on little tasks and micromanage the process or told they are too busy for your tasks it is not worth your time or energy.

Stay away!

At this time, we are surely having delays and are making adjustments to address that, but it might take us a few weeks to catch up, as from 30-50 tasks at one time, we went to hundreds in a very short time.”

The reason you hire an assistant is because you are busy. If you have follow up on little tasks and micromanage the process or told they are too busy for your tasks it is not worth your time or energy.

originalText.text:
This service rocks. I have received tons of great work back from their team and I've received some bad work back too. That said, anytime I've received bad work back I realized it was because my directions were bad. It's just like delegation, you get back what you ask for.

You get great results if you give good directions and that's the bottom line. Very solid service. Great job Fancy Hands keep it up and thank you!
